com.neophob.lib.rainbowduino
Class Rainbowduino

java.lang.Object
  com.neophob.lib.rainbowduino.Rainbowduino

public class Rainbowduino
extends java.lang.Object

library to communicate with an arduino via serial port
the arduino control up to n rainbowduinos using the i2c protocol

part of the neorainbowduino library TODO: add blacklist for serial port detection!

Author:
Michael Vogt / neophob.com

Method Summary
 boolean connected()
          return connection state of lib
 void dispose()
          clean up library
 long getAckErrors()
          how may times the serial response was missing / invalid
 int getArduinoBufferSize()
          return the serial buffer size of the arduino the buffer is by default 128 bytes - if the buffer is most of the time almost full (>110 bytes) you probabely send too much serial data
 int getArduinoErrorCounter()
          get last error code from arduino if the errorcode is between 100..109 - serial connection issue (pc-arduino issue) if the errorcode is < 100 it's a i2c lib error code (arduino-rainbowduino error) check http://arduino.cc/en/Reference/WireEndTransmission for more information
 long getArduinoHeartbeat()
          per default arduino update this library each 3s with statistic information this value save the timestamp of the last message.
 boolean initRainbowduino(byte addr)
          initialize an rainbowduino device - send the initial image to the rainbowduino. check arduinoErrorCounter for any errors.

          send a serial ping command to the arduino board.

sendRgbFrame

public boolean sendRgbFrame(byte addr,
                            int[] data)
wrapper class to send a RGB image to the rainbowduino. the rgb image gets converted to the rainbowduino compatible "image format"

Parameters:
addr - the i2c address of the device
data - rgb data (int[64], each int contains one RGB pixel)
Returns:
true if send was successful

sendRgbFrame

public boolean sendRgbFrame(byte addr,
                            processing.core.PApplet data)
Send the image data of an PApplet to a Rainbowduino Device. The image gets resized and converted to a Rainbowduino compatible format

Parameters:
addr -
data -
Returns:
true if send was successful

sendRgbFrame

public boolean sendRgbFrame(byte addrTopLeft,
                            byte addrTopRight,
                            byte addrBottomLeft,
                            byte addrBottomRight,
                            processing.core.PApplet data)
Send a PImage to four Rainbowduino Device arranged as cube The image gets resized and converted to a Rainbowduino compatible format.

Parameters:
addrTopLeft - the address of the top left rainbowduino
addrTopRight - the address of the top right rainbowduino
addrBottomLeft - the address of the bottom left rainbowduino
addrBottomRight - the address of the bottom right rainbowduino
data -
Returns:
true if send was successful

sendFrame

public boolean sendFrame(byte addr,
                         byte[] data)
send a frame to the active rainbowduino the data needs to be in this format: buffer[3][8][4], The array to be sent formatted as [color][row][dots]

Parameters:
addr - the i2c address of the device
data - byte[3*8*4]
Returns:
true if send was successful

initRainbowduino

public boolean initRainbowduino(byte addr)
initialize an rainbowduino device - send the initial image to the rainbowduino. check arduinoErrorCounter for any errors.

Parameters:
addr - the i2c slave address of the rainbowduino
Returns:
true if send was successful

getArduinoErrorCounter

public int getArduinoErrorCounter()
get last error code from arduino if the errorcode is between 100..109 - serial connection issue (pc-arduino issue) if the errorcode is < 100 it's a i2c lib error code (arduino-rainbowduino error) check http://arduino.cc/en/Reference/WireEndTransmission for more information

Returns:
last error code from arduino

getArduinoBufferSize

public int getArduinoBufferSize()
return the serial buffer size of the arduino the buffer is by default 128 bytes - if the buffer is most of the time almost full (>110 bytes) you probabely send too much serial data

Returns:
arduino filled serial buffer size

getArduinoHeartbeat

public long getArduinoHeartbeat()
per default arduino update this library each 3s with statistic information this value save the timestamp of the last message.

Returns:
timestamp when the last heartbeat receieved. should be updated each 3s.

getAckErrors

public long getAckErrors()
how may times the serial response was missing / invalid

Returns:

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> scanI2cBus()
Scan I2C bus on a connected rainbowduino device

Returns:
List of found i2c devices
